data.title: So fast and So delicious
data.text: We went to the one closest to the convention center and I was surprised at how fast and good it was-fast food meets sushi!!

data.title: @ the other bar
data.text: My boyfriend and I got there 30 minutes before the restaurant opened but we were already too late! We just missed the cut-off to get seated at the sushi bar and all the tables were already reserved. Since we had a flight to catch later that night, we opted to sit at the bar where the drinks were. The waiter/bartender was fairly easy going and held up a good conversation. We ordered the omakase but it turned out to be a bit disappointing because it just wasn't the same experience. They didn't ask whether we had any food allergies or preference for a certain type of fish over another. Presentation was decent and on all in one plate versus one at a time. Another downside was how loud the bar area was due to the conversation next to us. I get it, it's the bar area and I might've been a tad bit uptight but I was expecting a bit more class. I'd go back a second time to give it another try but definitely at the sushi bar.

data.title: Fast food done right
data.text:
Needed a quick lunch between medical appointments, so nothing heavy or spicy. Sushi Kudasai fit the bill. Good sushi, fresh salads, quick service and reasonable prices elevate this fast food place to four stars.

Husband ordered a sushi assortment with salad and I got the ramen noodle soup with two pieces of sushi. Broth was sweeter than I expected but good, and the ramen had the right amount of chewiness. Sushi tasted fresh and had a good fish to rice ratio. Next time I'll try the rolls; they looked good as well. A perfect stop for a quick lunch.

data.title: Quick sushi meal
data.text:
Good sushi, quickly-made, reasonably priced

If you want a quick sushi meal without the frills, this is the place to go.  This is not one of those "date night" sushi places.  We went for lunch and customers were mostly professionals buying sushi "to go".  There were some tables in the restaurant if you wanted to eat-in.  Friendly service.

data.title: Quick good sushi on 4th Ave.
data.text: Good sushi and very quaint place.  Good place to eat at before going to a show at the Paramount Theater.  The seaweed salad was good as well.

data.title: Delicious at the right price
data.text:
Delicious sushi at a very reasonable price.  No single platter was over $15. Plus they give white ginger, so you know it's good sushi. 
The food was also delivered to our table very quickly and you can watch the chef make the sushi.

data.title: Finally! A good, yet quick, sushi option in downtown Seattle
data.text: I worked nearby for years without any idea this place existed. Hiding deep inside the lobby of the K&L Gates office building at 4th & Madison - past Simons and a barbershop). Fortunately, a co-worker recommended I check it out. Absolutely delicious and so quick. There is plenty of seating for dine-in guests, but they also do take-out which is ideal for busy work days. The staff are very friendly and the vibe is nice - upbeat music playing on the radio, and everyone seems to be in a good mood. The prices are reasonable - you can get a simple roll like California for around $5-6 - or you can order a deluxe option for about double (but they are worth it - quite elaborate). You can also order individual pieces, so if you just want one piece of albacore, you can get in and out for under $2. I love this place - be warned, you may get hooked.

data.title: Excellent sushi
data.text: This recently opened addition to their other downtown Seattle locations hit the spot and has first-rate sushi.  It's located in the 4th & Madison bldg lobby, which has very limited dining options.  Yes the place is quite small, and does have some seating, otherwise you can take-out.  Sushi is fresh and reasonably priced.  If you don't like sushi, you can order udon or an avocado salad.  I think that's it for the non-sushi lover.  I typically dine there once a week now, taking different folks who too enjoy sushi and their reaction is the same as mine - delicious!  Check it out.
